project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to define the burndown chart criterium in the board configuration globally, which will affect the reports like velocity chart or burndown chart. Ideally it would be possible to switch this while viewing the different charts, taking the one in the board configuration as a default.

To achieve the same, i currently have to create a clone of the original board and then change the criterium there. This is of course is feasible, but gets a little frustrating, when you add/remove e.g. quck filters, swimlanes etc, as you have to do this to all the clones. As there is not such thing as "private" boards or marking boards as favorites, it also gets a little confusing after some time, when someone searches for a certain board.
fields.summary: As a user, i'd like to be able to switch burndown criteria while viewing a report

fields.description:
We have been using and depend on version hierarchy for as long as we've used Jira/Greenhopper/Agile (about 3 years now). It continues to work for now but I keep seeing references saying the Classic Board is going away. The only thing we still use on the Classic Board is defining the version hierarchy as we add new versions. I typically get a page timeout when I navigate to the Classic Board so I can only assume it's seldom used.

I'll explain our release cycle to give context. We release a major product version every 4 months (version 21 is active and 22 is under development). Each product version cycle contains about six 2 week feature sprints, several hardening sprints, release/upgrade for customer instances, and then about 4 to 7 patches to production instances until that major version gets replaced with next major version. We have a unique minor version number for each of these builds/releases that is a child to the major version number.

Without version hierarchy, a whole bunch of our filters that reference parent versions will stop working and become impractical. In other words, these queries would need to reference many versions instead of just the parent version. In addition, we often target issues first to a major release and subsequently to a child version (release build) as the more detail planning occurs. Without the version hierarchy, this practice will most likely become overly complex and no longer work. Yes, we do use Agile boards but mostly for high level enhancement/feature planning and not for all the defects and other gritty details.

Is the version hierarchy capability and behavior going to be migrated to core Jira? still part of Agile?  Now that sprints and fixVersion have been separated it seems logical to move it to core Jira. I sure hope version hierarchy doesn't just disappear one day when Atlassian puts a new release out to AOD.

I've dug through the documentation (and Answers) and all I see is statements saying the Classic Board is going away. That's fine as long as the current version hierarchy behavior continues to be supported. Can I get a definitive answer as to the product plans related to this.
fields.summary: Need version hierarchy after Classic Board goes away

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The red line indicating the percentage of stories without estimates in the Version Report is always flat at 0, regardless of the actual data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Version;
# Assign both estimated and unestimated issues to the Version;
# View the JIRA Agile Version Report.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Percent Unestimated Issues' (red line) indicates the percentage of issues in the Version that don't have an estimate.

h3. Actual Results
The line is always flat at 0.

h3.Notes
The unestimated issues are still listed correctly under the chart.

!Screen Shot 2014-08-14 at 15.55.43.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Percent Unestimated Issues' in JIRA Agile Version Report is Always at 0

fields.description:
The links to issue key is not clickable due to some large user full name covering the cards, this happen when there is missing avatar of the affected user.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Set up JIRA with JIRA gile
# Create new user and assign the user a ticket
# Add a custom avatar for the user
# Add the particular ticket in a Sprint and start
# Go to Work mode to see the card with the user's avatar
# Shutdown JIRA
# Go to {{$JIRA_HOME/data/avatars}} directory and move the recently add user avatars to another folder
# Start up JIRA
# Go to the Work mode of that particular Sprint
# (Optional) Add one more column, move a Resolved status in the new column. After that, open Issue Detail View. This way the Full name will cover the link as per the image below.

h4. Actual results
!Selection_012.png!

h4. Expected results
The missing avatar should be replaced with the default avatar or use the user's intial. This way it will avoid unable to click on the issue key link.
fields.summary: Cards in Work Mode Covered by Assignee Name when Avatar is Missing

fields.description:
Action:

Take a large JIRA (1.1M issues) with hundreds of Agile boards
Upgrade JIRA from 5.2.4 to 6.2.7 using a database, not XML.
Do the upgrade with no add-ons
Then install JIRA Agile 6.4.3 by uploading the jar into the UPM, not via m.a.c

Observed:

The install in UPM hangs about 80% of the way through until it completes 70 minutes later.
See the atlassian-greenhopper.log snippet below.
There are no messages after 17:30 about what is happening
There are no errors in the atlassian-jira.log since there are no errors.

Expected:

If an operation is going to take 70 minutes to complete on a large instance of JIRA some message should indicate this in the logfile.
This issue was created as a bug because I think that the JIRA Agile installation process has missing log messages.

fields.description:
In all our projects so far we switched form Story Points to Time Estimations as Customer needs it anyway - and as far as we learned, remaining effort estimations delivers more accurate results / estimates for us.
As long as the new Charts only work with Story Points, there is no way for me and my Customers to swich (and there are some big ones, like telcos, business integrators ang gambling industries...)
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I need to use Time Estimations / Logged Work / Remaining Work instead of Story Points

fields.description:
Hi,

A custom [dashboard|https://unicorntraining.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=11200] I have used successfully for a few months has recently stopped rendering all chart gadgets, for the last week or so.  This happens for the recent versions of Chrome, Firefox and IE.

I have come to rely on this dashboard as a means to determine the status of our product, and would really appreciate some feedback on this soon.

I tried filtering current support requests, but couldn't see anything similar, so please feel free to resolve for another issue.

Thanks,
Darren

fields.description:
h5.steps to reproduce 1
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# configure multiple tabs in the screen;
# position the _Sprint_ field at the bottom of a tab;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* all fields are displayed in one tab, with an indent indicating different tabs; clicking tabs to switch doesn't have any effect - [^sprint1.png], [^sprint2.png].

h5.steps to reproduce 2
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# position the _Sprint_ field above a system field, e.g. _Component_, _Fix Version_, _Summary_;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* _Sprint_ field will be displayed over the next field in order - [^sprint7.png].

h6.Special case
If another field with the name "Sprint" is configured in the same screen, and both fields are positioned next to each other, with the locked one on top, they're somewhat merged:  [^sprint5.png], [^sprint6.png].

Same screens for non subtasks are working correctly.

fields.description:
h4.Problem:

In systems with a large amount of users and issues, the ranking/clone/edit issue operation fails with the following error.  

{code}
java.sql.DataTruncation: Data truncation
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:Microsoft SQL Server
	- version:11.00.2100
	- minor version:0
	- major version:11
Driver:
	- name:jTDS Type 4 JDBC Driver for MS SQL Server and Sybase
	- version:1.2.4
java.sql.DataTruncation: Data truncation
{code}
(!) The error may vary depending on your database type, mostly complaining on similar problem ie "value too long for type character varying(255)" in Postgres

h4.Diagnosis:

To identify you are running into this bug, run the following SQL
# {code:sql}
SELECT "FIELD_ID", LENGTH("RANK") as rankLength, COUNT(1)  FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" GROUP BY "FIELD_ID", rankLength ORDER BY rankLength DESC
{code}
This will show the sizes of rank values in the rank table. Note that {{rankLength}} values should not be approaching 255 (the maximum column size)
# {code:sql}SELECT 'ROWS_IN_BUCKET_0', "FIELD_ID", coalesce(COUNT(1), 0) AS rows_in_bucket FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "RANK" LIKE '0|%' GROUP BY "FIELD_ID"
UNION
SELECT 'ROWS_IN_BUCKET_1', "FIELD_ID", coalesce(COUNT(1), 0) AS rows_in_bucket FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "RANK" LIKE '1|%' GROUP BY "FIELD_ID"
UNION
SELECT 'ROWS_IN_BUCKET_2', "FIELD_ID", coalesce(COUNT(1), 0) AS rows_in_bucket FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "RANK" LIKE '2|%' GROUP BY "FIELD_ID" ORDER BY "FIELD_ID";{code}
This query will show the bucket distribution of rank values. If there are ranks in different buckets for a certain rank field and the maximum {{rankLength}} of the previous query is approaching 255 for the same rank field, then the system is close to rank exhaustion and will start generating ranks larger than the max column size thus triggering the SQL exception.


h4.Workaround:

This will involve some manual database modification, please contact support while providing the information below:
# the result of the following SQL
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK";
{code}
# latest [JIRA support zip|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Getting+Help#GettingHelp-CreatingaSupportZip]
# (If possible) a copy of an XML backup of your database (_Administration > Backup System_). You can anonymise if you wish by going to [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Anonymising+data?utm_source=support] to speed up the testing process.

fields.description:
As a user who is viewing the board in Work mode, I want to see sub-tasks on the board even when using Quick Filters. 

I have a project board that has a number of quick filters for different Epics. My team wants to see the sub tasks on the board that roll up to a story that is part of an epic. So for example there is Epic A and we have a quick filter to show only work that is part of Epic A. Story B is part of Epic A.  Story B with several sub tasks. When we use the quick filter for Epic A the sub tasks do not display even though they are part of a story that is part of Epic A. We want to see the sub-tasks on the board and not have them be hidden by the Quick Filter.
fields.summary: Display sub-tasks on the Work mode of the board when using Quick Filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues from distinct projects and agile boards have issues appearing on one another's sprint. Distinct means, the boards don't share any similar filter criteria (in this case JIRA projects) and thus, no similar sprints to plan for.
Creating a fresh sprint in one board, leads to issues in the other board belonging to the same sprint. It is unclear yet, which the prerequisites are for the appearance and it seems rather arbitrary at the moment.
The Consequence, yet, is that the users (administrators) of the one board creating the sprint are unable to close it eventually. An error message is shown, they don't have the permissions to do that, because they are not administrators of the project on the second board with the suddently appearing sprint.

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Have two boards A and B with distinct filters (multiple projects on one board, single project on another board, but not the same!)
* Create a sprint on board A
* Assign issues to the sprint
* Start Sprint
* At an unknown point in time (during sprint of 2 Weeks), the sprint from board A appears on board B having issues from board B assigned to it

h3. Expected Results
* Sprints from idependent boards (different JIRA projects) only appear on their respective boards 
* Sprints from idependent boards (different JIRA projects) only contain issues explicitly assigned to them

h3. Actual Results
* Sprint from board A appears on board B having issues from board B assigned to it
* In the history of the issues on board B, not a single mention says, they have ever been assigned a sprint
* Ending the sprint in board A causes an ending in board B with a sprint report

h3. Notes
* I could ensure no issue has been cloned from one to another project
* The issues on board B have been created far before the existence (over 1 year) of the sprint in board A
* First time I noticed this, I assumed a misconfiguration, however, we had this issue now several times, suspiciously on the same board constellation - so maybe this is a unique situation

h3. Workaround
* Workaround is to grant admin rights on the projects presented, however, this is a very dirty one and it does not prevent the sprint artifact creation on board B
fields.summary: Issues from distinct projects and boards appear on a sprint of the other board

fields.summary: An error occurs whilst rendering "Sprint" box for Bulk Update Edit page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logging time in the future on a JIRA issue, JIRA Agile will not render the Burndown chart correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log time in the future on an issue that is within an active sprint.
# View the burndown chart for that sprint.

h3. Expected Results

The line does not render incorrectly.

h3. Actual Results

* The line appears to wrap back onto itself as per the attached screenshot.
* The line appears as an extra line on the burndown chart itself.

h3. Workaround

Delete the work log as per [Logging Work on an Issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue#LoggingWorkonanIssue-Deletingaworklogentry].

fields.description:
AS A developer using jira having transitioned a ticket from one state in a workflow to the next I WANT the issue to appear at the bottom of the queue SO THAT we can maintain first in first out for each step in the kanban or scrum work board

AS A system admin I WANT to add a post function to some workflows that will rank an issue to the bottom of the queue when it transitions states SO THAT in a work board (kanban or agile) when issues move out of one state, they queue up at the bottom of the next state by default, rather than current behaviour of apparent 'random' insertion (based on global rank).

AS A system admin I WANT a global parameter to 'Set rank to bottom upon any state change" SO THAT I can make that the system-wide default behavior

AS A project admin I WANT a project parameter to 'Set rank to bottom upon any state change" SO THAT I can make that the project-wide default behavior, or override the system-default behavior

Current behavior of 'random-ish' insertion could almost be considered a bug/defect for Kannan teams..

version: whatever is on OnDemand at 8/8/2014

For example, if we have the following linear workflow states:
- New -> Ready for Specification -> Specification -> Ready for Design -> Design -> Breakdown -> Estimation -> Ready for Development -> Development -> Review -> Resolved -> Documentation -> Closed

When something moves from 'Ready for Desgin' into 'Desgin', it should be at the bottom of the design queue. When it moves from Estimation to Ready for Development, it should be at the bottom of the Ready for Development queue.

This is not ALWAYS the desired behavior, especially if one has taken pains to set a global priority, but in some teams focusing on flow this works well.
fields.summary: Issue post function to "rank to bottom" upon status change

fields.description:
1) Open an Agile Board with more than 1 Issue listed.
2) Place your mouse over the link for an Issue that is NOT currently the selected row in the board.  The underline should appear.
3) Right-click the link.

Expected result:
The typical right-click menu for a browser appears, allowing the user the option to open that link in a new tab/browser, as was likely their intent by right-clicking.

Actual result:
The right-click appears to be highjacked and turned into a left-click.  The issue is loaded in the right-hand side and the row in the board becomes selected.  Now that the row is selected, right-click works as expected.
fields.summary: Right-click Issue Link in Agile Board doesn't bring up right-click menu

fields.description:
Editing fields via Edit action in preview pane doesn't trigger soft refresh. Current known fields are as below:
* Issue Type
* Priority

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a JIRA project with JIRA Agile Kanban board
# Set the filter query for the board to only query issues with specific issue type e.g. "project = TEST AND issuetype = Bug"
# Create a Bug issue and the issue should be visible in the Kanban Board
# Click to preview the issue in Agile board
# Click on "Actions"(triple dots) button in the preview and click "Edit"
# Change the issue's issue type to something other than *Bug* and the issue will still showing in the board

Changing *Assignee* field will trigger soft refresh for the board.

On the other hand, when the issue's issue type is edited in normal JIRA view(not through preview pane), the board will get a soft refresh - issue will disappear without the user need to refresh the browser.
fields.summary: Editing fields via Edit action in preview pane doesn't trigger soft refresh

    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially(LexoRankOperation.java:169)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.execute(LexoRankOperation.java:111)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankService.performRankOperation(LexoRankService.java:239)
    ...
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.getLexoRankValue(LexoRankIndexer.java:72)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.getIndexValue(LexoRankIndexer.java:65)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.addDocumentFields(LexoRankIndexer.java:51)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.addDocumentFieldsSearchable(LexoRankIndexer.java:39)
{noformat}

It is currently unknown how JIRA Agile is creating these duplicated rank fields. You can easily identify this by navigating to {{Administration >> Issues >> Custom Fields}}, check if there are multiple Rank custom fields of type Global Rank. (Not obsolete) 

When you have multiple rank fields, JIRA may be using the wrong Rank field while indexing issues. (The rank field that was not used in the balancing) So while indexing JIRA fails to find the maximum marker and minimum row.

A KB has been created describing this in detail: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Cannot+reindex+jira+due+to+Expected+exactly+2+rows+the+maximum+marker+row+and+the+lowest+ranked+row+for+rank+field

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-10970].
  {panel}

For some reason, a sprint in one board is related to another sprint in another board. For example:
# the boards may share some common issues and these issues are added to a sprint in each board (because of overlapping filter queries)
# a result of a bug as reported in GHS-10967

Owing to this, when this sprint is started/completed, the other sprint is also started/completed, and the following scenario happens:
* sprint1 in board1 contains issues A1, B2
* sprint1 in board2 contains issues C1, B2
(i) take note of the common issue B2 and assume that all these 3 issues are incomplete
* if sprint1 in board1 is completed and there's a sprint2 in this board, then:
** A1, B2 will be moved to sprint2 of board1
** for board2, as sprint1 is *indirectly* completed:
*** B2 will be moved to a new sprint2 in board2
(i) this sprint2 will always be newly created even if there's an existing sprint2 in the board
*** C1 will be moved to the backlog
* if sprint1 in board2 is completed first, the same thing happens in the other way round
fields.summary: Incomplete issues not moved to the next sprint if the original sprint is indirectly completed

fields.description:
When creating a new issue, one can select a Sprint to add the issue to. However, if there are many sprints with the same name, then the creator does not know which is the right one to choose. There has been a Suggestion for this at:
* [Update Sprint Field to Display Agile Board Next to Sprint Name|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38254]

In case the creator just selects a random Sprint and creates the issue, and that Sprint is not the right one for the board that contains the issue, a new Sprint with the same name will be created in that board, and _*control/follow the start/complete of the Sprint that the creator selected in the first place*_.

Steps to reproduce:
* create board1 with filter for project1
* create board2 with filter for project2
(i) the filter queries of the 2 boards are mutually exclusive (totally different) and never updated along the way
* create a sprint with name Sprint 1 in each board
* create some issues in project1 and add them to +Sprint 1 of board1+
* now create 1 issue in project2 and add it to +Sprint 1 of board1+

{panel}(!) the effect is another Sprint 1 will be created in board2{panel}
{panel}(x) starting/completing Sprint 1 in board1 or the new Sprint 1 in board2 will cause the other to follow the same process i.e. started/completed together{panel}
 
----
Another unexpected effect is, if there's a Sprint 2 in each board as well, then:
* if Sprint 1 in board1 is completed:
** incomplete issues in this Sprint will be moved to Sprint 2 of board1, which is expected
** incomplete issues in the new Sprint 1 of board2 will NOT be moved to Sprint 2 of board2, but to the backlog instead, which is not expected
* if the new Sprint 1 of board2 is completed: the same thing happens in the other way round

(i) This can be treated as an Improvement and should be addressed separately in GHS-10970
fields.summary: Unexpected effects when adding issues to a wrong sprint

fields.description:
It is naturally expected that if you don't have "Parallel Sprints" enabled, it should be impossible to have Multiple Active sprints showing up on the same board. However, this is not the case. There is a reproducible scenario, in which multiple active sprints will appear in a JIRA Agile board eventhough Parallel Sprints are not turned on, and this could cause some confusion for users.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Ensure Parallel Sprints are turned off on your JIRA Agile instance
* Configure two boards, one a subset of the other, but both pointing to the same project:
**  Board A's filter could be: "Project = XYZ ORDER BY Rank ASC"
** Board B's filter could be: "Project = XYZ AND issuetype = bug ORDER BY Rank ASC"
* Start a sprint on Board A, made of stories/tasks but not including any issues of bug issuetype (It is important to not include any issuetype bug to the first sprint in Board A at this point so you dont automatically start a sprint in Board B whose filter includes the bug issuetype)
* At this point Board A has one active sprint, and board B has none.
* Now start a sprint in Board B.

*Result*
* The Sprint started in Board B is also added to Board A which already has one active sprint. Causing multiple active sprints in Board A.

*Remarks*
* It is recommended that each Project have it's own JIRA Agile board, and this scenario will not come up under this configuration. However, certain customer's usecases may cause them to have different teams sharing a project, while each team has their own board (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5410 - Again, the recommended usage here is to ensure that each team's board returns a unique set of issues - otherwise you would experience this issue at some point and the results may not be desirable)
* I have not raised this as a bug, because the behavior is not necessarily incorrect (although it's confusing). The configuration of both board's filters suggests that Board A is a Parent Board for Board B, which causes sprints from the child board to show in the parent.
* Why is this confusing? Well, for most users, this result is not what they intended at all. Users of Board B for instance may be unaware that there is another board with configuration as Board A. Even if they are aware, they may not be thinking that their action of starting a sprint in their board has started a sprint on someone else's board.

*Suggestion*
 I guess this scenario can be handled better by JIRA Agile, if atleast a message at the top of Board A automatically shows up whenever this scenario has led to multiple active sprints. Explaining to all board users, how they came across the other active sprints (perhaps mentioning who started the sprint or from which board they were started). Even something as simple as the following will help:
bq. "You are currently having multiple active sprints on this board. This may be because you have other boards whose filters are a subset of this board's filter, active sprints from those other boards will automatically show up here."
fields.summary: Multiple Active Sprints showing up on one board, although Parallel Sprints have been disabled

fields.description:
I am informed by Atlassian support of the following points (see https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/ghs/problem-report-12832):

* The uninstall _intentionally_ leaves behind various pieces of the configuration - e.g. issues types.
* If the user stupidly removes these no-longer-needed pieces, he cannot reinstall the plugin unless he recreates them by hand.

This is clearly an undesirable feature and leads to the plugin not being able to handle a typical use case:

* Install Jira Agile for evaluation.
* Uninstall _completely_.
* Reinstall for re-evaluation.

I can't believe anyone consciously decided to make the uninstall this way;). The recommondation from support that one should leave the configuration after uninstallation is a poor workaround.

The fix is the following:

* Uninstall should uninstall _everything_. Or at worst offer this as an option.
* Reinstall should reinstall the plugin, even if it has been previously uninstalled.

In the meantime, there should be a big warning about this feature - see GHS-10956.
fields.summary: Jira Agile uninstall does not completely uninstall Jira Agile.

Due to this, customers need to manually re-create the custom fields, issue types and configuration which is very tedious job. 

This can be avoided with the below approach:
# We should mention in the documentation / installation page that Agile plugin will not re-create the deleted custom fields, issue types or configuration data on the next installation.

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I need the ability to tie Sprints to specific "teams" to marry them together for Velocity charting, and other metrics.

Acceptance Criteria:
* During the creation of the Sprint entity, demonstrate that the sprint can be categorized with a "team" enitity (or label).
* In the board reports, demonstrate that the Velocity report has the ability to show only the sprints that share the same "team".
* On the different JIRA Dashboard "Wall Board Plugins" related to JIRA Agile, demonstrate that they can be filtered to only use sprints with a specific "team" categorization.



*More detail:*
I have multiple JIRA projects that represent different "Pillars" (i.e. different types of work).  I have Scrum teams that each have a _primary_ pillar, but that can perform work on any pillar during any sprint based on the company's goals at any given time. 

Each scrum team, while potentially working on the same application as a different team, is it's own stand-alone body, complete with DB Devs, App Devs, QA-Testers, DevOps, and Product Owners.

The problem I have is, since teams aren't isolated to Pillars, we generally have a larger unified backlog that serves the whole department, and we use quick filters to show pillar specific tasks if a team is only going to work within a specific pillar.

I have a unique sprint for each team, in order to track velocity, capacity, and success on an individual team level. This is because they estimate on within their own team.  Thus, Velocity should be unique among teams.

Unfortunately, Since each scrum board must include issues from every Pillar (i.e. Jira Project) since a team can work within any of them, the Velocity report shows ALL sprints, rather than just the ones for the Team I'm interested in.

I currently have no way to "tie sprints together".   I *could* filter each board by a ticket field, but this would mean I need to manage that field for _every_ ticket.  ANNOYING.  Thus, the Sprint label would simply this process.
fields.summary: Assign Sprints to "Teams"

fields.description:
We have some odd behavour for moving stories between epics.

A new user to a JIRA Agile project, created a number of Epics and then started to create new Stories. After realising they were under the wrong epic they decided to update the epic value in the ticket. By going to Edit option on their tickets and using the Epic drop down list they found that selecting a new Epic, wasn't always the same epic that the ticket got associated to.

Actions Tried
1) We tried removing the epic first then adding a new epic but again this functionality didn't work.
2) We moved around different epics and there seemed to be a pattern to which epic would be saved but it wasn't the one that was selected.
3) We got the change of epics to work by using the drag and drop functionality in the Plan view of the Agile board.

Question
Why when changing the epics via the "edit" ticket details doesn't provide the same functionality as the drag and drop?

This functionality has been seen in both IE9 and Google Chrome

fields.summary: Creating Scrum board with sample data throws unexpected error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

Our development methodology (based on FDD) uses Kanban and Scrum boards at same time in each project.

The "Epic" (recognized as "FeatureSet" in FDD) is the main element to group/find/structure all itens in the project scope.

So, in this way, the analists use Kanban boards (in the overall modeling phase) to discover issues (recognized as "Features" in FDD) and them use the Epics to group them.

After epics and features pass by "planning" status in the workflow... the programmers visualize them in the proper Scrum boards.

The problem is that, although the Scrum board (used by programmers)  can group  issues into the respectively epics (using the Swimlanes config), the Kaban boards (used by analysts) cannot :(

I know that we can configure Swimlanes by Queries, but it is improdutive, because (first) we use the same kaban for all projects here and (second) using this approach, we need to configure-and-reconfigure the Kanban board each time that an Epic is created/changed/deleted.

A nice feature would be Swimlanes by Epics in Kanban board, as show in attached and is currently available in Scrum boards.
fields.summary: As a Kanban Board user, I would like to group issues by epic link in Swimlanes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Sprint duplication choice or notification when moving an issue between projects}}

h3. Current behaviour

When a ticket from Project A is linked to a sprint and is then moved from JIRA Project A to JIRA project B, the sprint is duplicated in project's B Agile board. Many users would like the sprint field to be cleared out or at least to be notified  by the system that this issue is going to occur if he proceeds with this operation.

h3. Expected behaviour

Option 1: Allow the users to configure in JIRA Agile if they want the sprint field to be cleared when the issue is moved to another project that is not filtered by the board, or if they want to keep the existing behaviour to duplicate the sprint in the new board as well.

Option 2: Keep the existing behaviour but always notify the user that the sprint is going to be duplicated, so the users are not taken by surprise when sprints appear in different boards.
fields.summary: Ability to move an issue without copying Agile sprint information

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you disable GH Analytics Tracker, it makes JIRA Agile inaccessible. At first, it will allow you to click the "Agile" button and shows the dropdown list. But after that, the "Agile" button is no longer working.
!analytics_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!analytics_2.jpg|thumbnail!

But when you enable GH Analytics Tacker, it will make JIRA Agile accessible again.
!analytics_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!analytics_4.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Disabling Analytics Module makes the JIRA Agile Inaccessible
